There isnt a consensus that it is reliable either. We can call in the RS people again, and get the arbcom back up to decide this if nessecary. But, from what I have read, bcskeptics isnt reliable
There is not a consensus; this information is based on statements of people who were there and is quite important.
This is simple POV pushing. There have been discussions about it, and the general consensus is that bcskeptics isnt a reliable source. You are welcomed to start a new discussion on the topic.

Arbom's "final decision" is a completely misleading and factually inaccurate claim regarding the source. If you are removing it, please do so stating that u r doing it as per a WP:RS comment. See talk
/* Criticism and controversy */ I dont know who removed these tags, but there hasnt been significant enough change to remove them.
The ArbCom's final decision was that bcskeptics was not a reliable source. I'm sorry you (dilip) and your alter egos dont like their decision, but it isnt your place challenge it in article.
/* Further Reading */
Adding links to related articles.
Please give reference to the original discussion - not selected comments copy pasted on talk. What you need to establish is that it was decided by majority of the comments that the source is not RS

Don't add back unreliable source back into the article!. bcskpetic was declared as selfpublished and unreliable source by the wikipedia reliable source notice board. Read the updates in the talk page.
I can't find an arbcom statement to the effect - could you please point out on talk.
Removing information sourced to bcskeptic - another unreliable source used in the article
No, its not a cover up. The arbritration committee declared bcskeptics an unreliable source, and the information was removed.

Removing the remaining Basava Premananda references from the article. Basava Premanada and his book were declared as unreliable source in the BostonMA mediation discussion in 2006
